questions.question: ............................. of us were ill so we didn't go to work.
questions.description: Both is used in affirmative clauses to speak of two people or things.

questions.question: He has eaten .............................. of the chops.
questions.description: Both means one and the other.

questions.question: I don't like .................................. of the colors.
questions.description: Either means one or the other.

questions.question: I liked ................................. colors.
questions.description: Both means one and the other.

questions.question: I have invited ................................ of them.
questions.description: Both means one and the other.

questions.question: I have not invited .................................... of them.
questions.description: Instead of writing both ...not, we use not either or neither.

questions.question: .................................. key opens the door.
questions.description: We use neither before a singular noun.

questions.question: I could not choose between them - I liked them ...........................
questions.description: Both means one and the other.

questions.question: ................................. Mark nor Samuel passed the test.
We ................................ liked the movie.
questions.description: Both means one and the other.
